CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

1. donor-acceptor (D-A) type copolymers
2. highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO)
3. lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO)
4. donor units
5. acceptor units
6. band gap
7. Thiophene
8. bridged dithiophene
9. carbon (C)
10. silicon (Si)
11. germanium (Ge)
12. nitrogen (N)
13. cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT)
14. dithienosilole (DTS)
15. dithienogermole (DTG)
16. dithieno [3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP)
17. C-C bond
18. C-Si bond
19. conjugated polymer backbones
20. DTS-based photovoltaic polymers
21. PC 70 BM
22. benzothiadiazole (BT)
23. imine (-CvN-) nitrogen
24. 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT)
25. fullerene derivatives
26. D-A copolymers.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

1. The band gap of the D-A type copolymers can be tuned by the choice of donor (D) and acceptor (A) units. No specific values or units are given for these material properties.
2. Thiophene is a block used to construct new D-A type copolymers, but no specific values or units are given for its properties.
3. The bridged dithiophene has the ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure. The planarity of a molecular structure can affect its properties, but no specific values or units are given for this property.
4. Four bridging dithiophene units are mentioned, each with a different atom at their center: carbon (C), silicon (Si), germanium (Ge), and nitrogen (N). These elements do not have units, but their atomic weights in grams per mole could be considered a unit of measurement.
5. CPDT was first introduced into low band gap polymers and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE (power conversion efficiency) of 5.5%. The unit for PCE is percentage (%).
6. Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum. Mobility is typically measured in cm^2/Vs and light absorption in this context is usually reported in terms of a wavelength (e.g., nm) or frequency (e.g., Hz). However, no specific values or units are given in the text.
7. DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si bond. Steric hindrance can affect various properties of a material, but no specific values or units are given in the text.
8. DTP has good π-conjugation and has been applied to organic electronic materials. The degree of π-conjugation can affect various properties of a material, but no specific values or units are given in the text.
9. D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron-donating unit exhibit low band gap and enhanced solubility. The unit for band gap is eV, but no specific value is given in the text. Solubility is typically measured in units of concentration (e.g., M) over time (e.g., s) at a given temperature (e.g., K). However, no specific values or units are given in the text.
10. Benzothiadiazole (BT) containing the electron-withdrawing imine (-C=N-) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. The electron-withdrawing ability of a group can be measured in terms of its Hammett constant or other related quantities, but no specific values or units are given in the text.
11. Photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4%. The unit for PCE is percentage (%).

The electron-withdrawing ability of a group can be measured in terms of its Hammett constant or other related quantities, but no specific values or units are given in the text.
